title: As has already been suggested, the effect of intercessory prayer may be to make some possibilities more likely to be actualized
Here ‘strict’ reflects the view of process theology that God is not to be treated as an exception to metaphysical principles, but is rather understood to be exemplifying them
See the account of Hartshorne’s thought on this matter in Fiddes
For another critique of this position, see Paul Fiddes

The whole of Fiddes’ chapter 4, pp.115ff (entitled ‘The God who Acts and the Point of Intercessory Prayer’) is relevant to our discussion and does not come to any essentially different conclusions than those reached here
